result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Deferred Acceptance of Guilty Plea agreement

2:33 PM Defendant Jason C Meissner in court. Attorney Dan Firkus in court for Jason C Meissner. Prosecuting attorney David Stilin in court for the State of Wisconsin. RL-clerk. Atty Firkus recites agreement for Deferred Acceptance of Guilty Plea agreement on count 1. On count 1- def- G plea. CT finds grounds to accept plea, but does not do so at this time due to Deferred Acceptance of Guilty Plea agreement. $150 DAGP fee to DA's office. Terms reviewed. CT reviews def's non-payment of ct appt attorney fees. Def states he can make a payment in about 2 weeks. CT- bond will be held for atty fees. Def indicates he will pay $100 on atty fees within a month. Def is agreeable to setting up wage assignment. 2:48 pm adj.
